job description:
Position Title: Senior Scientist

Working Location: Pennsylvania

Employment Status: Full time

Required Experience: 5 years

Required Education: Bachelors

Travel Required: 0%

Job Description:
The Advanced Technologies and Development group is part of Biopharmaceutical Analytical Sciences and is responsible for development of new product quality assays, novel methodologies, and platform methods to support GSKs biopharmaceutical product pipeline. The group uses a wide variety of state of the art methodologies including UPLC, cIEF, and CGE from development through validation, and is responsible for investigation and qualification of new separation modalities to further streamline the biopharma development process. The group also focuses on advances in automation and implementation/maintenance of open access systems.

Major Accountabilities:
  • Develop and qualify analytical methods for the analysis of recombinant proteins and biotherapeutics.
  • Perform HPLC/uHPLC and troubleshoot methods and equipment.
  • Perfom capillary gel electrophoresis (PA800+, or LabChip) and cIEF (Protein Simple). Troubleshoot methods and equipment.
  • Draft and review analytical methods, qualification reports and method development/characterization reports.
  • Generate, collate, critically analyze/review and draw conclusions from complex experimental data.
  • Evaluate and apply new techniques/technologies in relevant work areas and to adhere to and influence GxP policies and procedures.
  • Anticipate and identify problems, and execute corrective actions with minimal supervision.
  • Potential for managing project analytical sub teams and authoring relevant CMC sections of regulatory submissions.
Essential Skills:
  • Bachelors or Masters degree in a biotechnology/analytical chemistry/biochemistry related discipline, with a minimum of 5 years of experience in biopharmaceutical product development in the industrial environment.
  • Experience in working with separation and analysis of proteins and peptides.
  • Strong skills in HPLC/uHPLC separations using a variety of modalities (RPLC, SEC, IEX).
  • Experience in cIEF and capillary gel electrophoresis separation techniques such as Protein Simple, PA800+, or LabChip.
